title: Result of collision given average force

content.question: A ball, of mass 1.0kg, is released from rest above a horizontal surface. The ball falls downward and collides with the surface with a speed of <math alttext="2.0 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mspace></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mfrac><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The average force exerted during the collision is <math alttext="20 newtons " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> over a time interval of <math alttext="0.1 seconds " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following best predicts what will happen to the ball immediately after the collision?

choices.label: The ball will come to rest on the surface.
The ball will bounce up from the surface with a speed lower than what it had before the collision.
The ball will bounce up from the surface with the same speed as it had before the collision.
The ball will bounce up from the surface with a speed greater than what it had before the collision.

content.answer: The ball will come to rest on the surface.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
